In Thunderbird I get that my account is being processed

title: 115 auto expands all threads when moving to another folder
content:
Guess I was the moron for updating to 115. Now even when I collapse all threads. It ignores this and automatically expands all thread whenever I click to another folder that also had everything collapsed.

For instance if I'm in Inbox for account1@gmail.com and collapse all threads but then click to say drafts in the same account or another account and then back to Inbox on account1, it automatically expanded the collapsed threads. What is the point of having an option to expand or collapsed threads if Thunderbird can't remember the status.


Hope this can get fixed as it is very frustrating to have functionality like this along with most of the sort options all being greyed out now.

title: Thunderbird inbox has messages, but they don't show on the screen.
content: I just completed changing the storage location for Thunderbird email messages, from AppData/Roaming to a new Thunderbird folder under Documents. This was to ensure that my computer quick-backup utility would save emails. I followed Mozilla instructions and all went well, everything seems still to work just fine, except that one POP email account shows nothing in the appropriate Thunderbird Inbox now. Sent messages show up, and new incoming messages to that account go into the Inbox and show, but all the old ones from before the location change just don't populate the Inbox listing area. The Inbox file at the new location has messages in it, I can see and read them with Notepad, but there's no corresponding Inbox message list for that one account. What could have gone wrong, and is it possible to somehow 'activate' the old messages so they show, or move them again from the original AppData/Roaming location to the new one? Thanks!

title: Filter string
content: When i use LDAP and composte message TB in source code used search string with filter like somphing=*%v*. The domain server processes the request for a long time 5-10 sec. (I checked through command ldapsearch, with a request containing * at the beginning and at the end of the filter, result: long search (5-10 seconds). Is it possible to change the filter expression to something=%v* (with one symbol * in the end) in settings or other metods (without rebuild from sourses) ?
creator: ser812

title: Thrunderbird freezes at startup
content:
Hi, since I returned to Thunderbird (~5 months), every time I open the program it freezes for at least one minute before becoming responsive.

I have a gaming rig and I don't use any add-on so I cannot figure out why it happens. I'm available for any log sharing as this has happened for months and the following solutions only worked once (as with a restart everything returned unresponsive): - delete startup cache; - run Thunderbird on safe mode; - delete the profile and re-log on everything.

Current setup: - OS version: Windows 11 - RAM: 16GB - Thunderbird version: 115.2.0
creator: salvomanfredi

title: formatting within email
content: I am using Thunderbird 115.2.0 (32-bit) on a Windows 10 laptop. I have used TB for years and used to be able to easily change color, italicize, bold, etc. within an email but I can no longer find the controls for this. When I go to account settings I have only the options to choose which font and size for all my emails. I correspond with someone who has limited eyesight and often want to enlarge font or change color for part for emphasis, but don't want all my emails that enlarged. I'm sure i have overlooked a setting somewhere but it used to be at the top of the new email, as well as a drop-down button for making a hyperlink - I don't see that either anymore. Thanks
creator: drmeow

title: Why are so many improvements Not improvements?
content:
I would really appreciate any thoughts on resolving the items below even if I do have to be chastised for not finding the solutions for myself.

Whilst I appreciate the new ability to change the "spacing" between compact, default and relaxed I would appreciate knowing why it was not possible to change incrementally like we can now change Font Size?? There was a fix for this in previous versions which allowed me to display all of the folders that I wanted to display.

Why can the number of messages headers displayed only be 9 or more?

Why does the message header pane above the email content still have so much white space? It would still be totally readable if laid out in a different manner with much smaller line spacing.

I would also like to know why I cannot now have the likes of "get messages" in the menu bar? The current setup forces 2 toolbars or I can switch off the menu. I have had the 2 combined for some time.

With all the "improvements", why is there still no facility to order folders rather than having them alphabetically listed? The add-on to do this no longer works.

As you will guess, I am not best pleased with the changes in SuperNova as it has changed too many of the things that I have taken fore-granted over the years.

My thanks in advance for anything helpful the community is able to offer.
creator: firefox1532

title: Drafts not syncing TB to iOS (but working the other way round)
content:
I'm using Gmail in TB 115.2.0 (Supernova) and Windows 10.

If I create a draft in TB it appears on my iPhone as expected (and vice versa). When I edit the draft on the iPhone the edits appear in TB as expected. However, if I then try to edit the draft in TB those edits don't sync to the iPhone.

So just to be clear, drafts are created as expected but thereafter, edits only sync one way. All edits appear as expected on the Gmail web interface and on the Gmail iOS app. So the issue seems to be with TB.

Any ideas?

title: Problem importing emails
content: I installed Thunderbird on a new HD, and it appears to be running OK. I have now tried to import all my old emails, but this is where I have a problem. I selected 'Import from a file' as I had exported the emails to a separate HD. When I opened the ext HD I noticed the file said .zip, so I thought I should unzip it, this maybe where I went wrong. Then I selected 'Import a backed up profile' - already ticked was 'Import from a profile default' but I changed that to 'Choose a profile folder' and aded the one from my extHD. Once I had clicked 'Start import' an error message came up 'Import failed unexpectedly, more information may be available in the Error Console' So this is where I am at - and I have no idea where or what the 'Error Console' is. What have I done wrong, and what do I do now ?
creator: tisrplace

title: Can not dismiss notifications from NextCloud CalDAV Calendars
content:
After adding my nextcloud calendar via CalDAV in Thunderbird 115 (no plugin) I can perfecly add or remove events to the calendar and they get synced well, however, if I receive a notification the button to dismiss them does not do a thing. Firat I thought this is related to Birthday reminders, but it is also true for events I have added to the standard calendar via Thunderbird.

Sorry if this is a double post, but I only found similar issues with older versions of Thunderbird and a plugin for the calendar.
creator: g.steinwender

title: Thunderbird Supernova needs a Send Unsent button on mail toolbar
content:
Prior to V115 (Supernova), using the two extension buttons Send Later (in compose mail) and Get/Send (in the compose mail toolbar) worked well in tandem to easily facilitate composed emails being sent later with simple clicks. The former to place composed emails in the Outbox and the later to send emails from the Outbox.

Unfortunately, the Get/Send extension is no longer supported in V115. Send Later is still there and working.

Thunderbird provides send unsent messages via the File menu or a right click on the Outbox. It would be much smoother and consistent for there to be a Send Unsent button on the main mail toolbar.

Please take this as a request to provide the above at the earliest opportunity.

Thanks.
creator: bazzaman

title: Jumbled, illegible texts.
content:
I have discovered that screenshots have solved the problem: when a text is jumbled, all I need to do is go back to the original document, screenshoot it, and replace the jumbled text with the screenshot text. Before, I did not understand what a screenshot was, imagining that I was required to somehow attach a camera to the computer, take a photo, and somehow attach it to the email I wanted to send.

Many thanks for your patience and help with someone who so inept with the computer world. You are a great help.
creator: Jamesrsamec41

title: Identifying addresses mailed to or received from  for dead email accoumt in Thunderbird 59.2
content:
Hi. First, I have more tech problems than I can shake a stick at and I m dealing with concussion and screens (monitors, cell phone, etc) aggravates and I don't track as well online as usual, so I'm asking for help sooner than I would hoping y'all can break it down very smply for me. Thanks for reading.

Thunderbird v.59.2 on Windows Vista desktop. Yup, Vista :-) Cable provider died, so years of emails to addresses using isp-provided email addresses are in Thunderbird but can't use emails.

In short term got TMobile 5G wireless and it is hideous, beware! For now I use my cell as hotspot to get on internet on old desktop.

I'll list what I've tried in a sec, but here's my ultimate goal: I want to get AT&T fiber installed and hooked up on new desktop (Windows 11) and install latest thnder bird there and bring over old files. Before installing at&t I have to formally cancel with former cable provider (it's in an odd limbo). I've assumed it's better to cull all email addresses related to those email accounts before severing all ties.

What I tried: Followed this thread https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1255223

I can't upgrade to v60 with Vista. I modified advanced config and added strict config Boolean setting and set to false and added check compatibility 59.2 setting and set to false.

The email crawler add on still gives me not compatible error. I restarted Thunderbird and that didn't help, unfortunately.

What can I do?

Again, my two main concerns are 1) harvest email address on my dead email accounts so I can send notifications of my new email addresses and 2) prepare to move all Thunderbird stuff to new desktop once I have working wireless internet to facilitate.

Thank you for your patience with my explanation and any help you can provide.
creator: eden5
